injury, which The Associated Press said is giving pain to the 35-year-old point guard.`` It has to be removed and tested to see if it's benign or not,'' Gary Moore told AP. Once that's removed, Allen Iverson is going to look to rehabilitate his leg because the doctors tell him he'll be out four to six weeks. He's hoping to be able to play in the playoffs. Earlier on Wednesday, reports from several media outlets including Fox News and NBA.com reported that Allen Iverson may be looking to retire due to the injury, after receiving information from HoopsWorld regarding his status.
